page.title: 01General Review south: FINTRY
page.content:
The area which people who live here think of as Fintry, covers 4 squares of this Domesday Survey. See also:
{ 02640684, 02600687, 02560687}
Settlement is concentrated around the Fintry Cross, where the Kippen road passes over Endrick Water. This is the new town area of the mill-working days. The Cross is also the site of our second village school, presently the Leisure Centre. The first school is now a private house on the corner at the Denny Cross. This is the site of old Fintry and while several dwellings persist, others, remembered and lived in by older folk have sadly disappeared.
Predominantly a farming area, though most people work in neighouring towns.
